ygData.subject: Heritrix - Windows - DNS Java
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi folks, I know that the Heritrix crawler is not supported on windows, but thought I would share the last 2 weeks of experimentation of heritrix on windows

Subject: Heritrix - Windows - DNS Java
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=122916039; y=Iulh7wGmDc8uYce-hRJUru5uzle2gqwTfE9KAkdmSkbadmZ4Vg

Hi folks,

I know that the Heritrix crawler is not supported on windows, but thought I 
would share the last 2 weeks of experimentation of heritrix on windows and 
the conclusions that I have drawn. This is for information only, and if 
someone has the time to work on the one issue that I found, that would be 
great.

I was able to finish the experimentation of Heritrix on windows and found 
out that it has to do with the DNS Java components. I tried on windows XP, 
windows 2003 server enterprise edition set up as IIS and DNS servers on the 
network. Debugging the puppy shows that the calls are not making it through 
the system to the DNS Cache on the windows boxes, while on Red Hat 9.0 which 
I happily had a copy of, the system was up and running in a couple of hours 
collecting arc files.

Essentially then if I can get DNS Java working on the windows box (which has 
been the stumbling point at this time) then I should be able to do a good 
crawl using Heritrix. No worries there, it is going to be an interesting 
time if I decide to stay with Linux. Which I probably well because I am time 
constrained hugely lately.

If anyone is interested in taking on the DNS Java issue, this information 
should help, or you can give me a shout and we can go into a lot of 
technical information on this one.

Just thought I would share my findings on a non supported Operating System 
and my conclusions.

Cheers/r/Dan
